name: Buffalo Chickpea Jalapeno Poppers
description: Your next game night needs these vegan jalapeño poppers stuffed with a spicy buffalo chickpea, red bell pepper and scallion filling, then coated in a mixture of seasoned breadcrumbs and baked until golden brown

video.name: Buffalo Chickpea Jalapeño Poppers
video.description: Jalapeño Poppers stuffed with a buffalo chickpea filling, topped with panko breadcrumbs, and baked in the oven until golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl combine the tahini, water, lemon juice, and buffalo sauce (depending on how spicy you want it add 2 or 3 tbsp. of the buffalo sauce). Using a whisk, stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl combine the tahini, water, lemon juice, and buffalo sauce (depending on how spicy you want it add 2 or 3 tbsp. of the buffalo sauce). Using a whisk, stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the chickpeas in a large bowl, and smash with a fork, add green onion, and red bell pepper. Pour in the tahini-lemon mixture in stir to combine. Season to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the chickpeas in a large bowl, and smash with a fork, add green onion, and red bell pepper. Pour in the tahini-lemon mixture in stir to combine. Season to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the jalapeños with the chickpea mixture and place on a sheet tray lined with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill the jalapeños with the chickpea mixture and place on a sheet tray lined with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the panko breadcrumbs with the nutritional yeast and stir to combine. Cover the top of the jalapeño poppers with the breadcrumb mixture. Spray with avocado oil. Bake in oven for 20 – 25 minutes until the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Serve with this spicy avocado sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine the panko breadcrumbs with the nutritional yeast and stir to combine. Cover the top of the jalapeño poppers with the breadcrumb mixture. Spray with avocado oil. Bake in oven for 20 – 25 minutes until the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Serve with this spicy avocado sauce.
